metadata.min_stack_comments: New fields added: required_fields, related_integrations, setup

author: Elastic
rule.description:
Detects the successful hijack of Microsoft Compatibility Appraiser scheduled task to establish persistence with an
integrity level of system.
rule.name: Persistence via TelemetryController Scheduled Task Hijack
rule.note:
## Setup

If enabling an EQL rule on a non-elastic-agent index (such as beats) for versions <8.2, events will not define `event.ingested` and default fallback for EQL rules was not added until 8.2, so you will need to add a custom pipeline to populate `event.ingested` to @timestamp for this rule to work.
rule.query:
process where host.os.type == "windows" and event.type == "start" and
  process.parent.name : "CompatTelRunner.exe" and process.args : "-cv*" and
  not process.name : ("conhost.exe",
                      "DeviceCensus.exe",
                      "CompatTelRunner.exe",
                      "DismHost.exe",
                      "rundll32.exe",
                      "powershell.exe")
